positive.review:
I left rusty for two hours
came back and heâ€™d grown crops, earned money and upgraded the farm.
i left myself alone for 2 hours and did nothing but goon.
10/10 game

Pretty good. Easy to learn and play and generally satisfactory gameplay.

There's no progression to keep between new farms and I guess that's intentional, but I'd at least let you keep chips since they don't feel very impactful and you'd get more use out of some cool early-crop chips.

The berry bush / bees thing feels undercooked since it's just another way to get biofuel and berry bushes are the same just taking longer for more fuel.

Very cute idle game. So cozy and relaxing, and once you automate things, you can just do other stuff while watching over your farm. Artsyle is great, and it is a labor of love for the developer, with constant free updates with new things.

Fun idler - though its largely hands on. I wish progress carried between farms, mostly just the money and bio crystals and plant unlocks would be nice. There are frustrations when it comes to placement, as well as things you simply cannot destroy once placed.

I grabbed this game when it was on sale along with "Haiku the Robot" (another game by the same creator), and I will never regret it! This game is pure gold and I wish that there where more chill games like this one that were part of a series or franchise! I still remember only having one 4x4 square of fertile area and just waiting to unlock Haiku! I didn't want any upgrades or improvements until I had my favorite character! (and I didn't even know what he did, I just wanted to unlock him!) The aforementioned game takes place before this one, and it was fun to see most characters reappear in this entry as well. For the price it's at this is a steal, and I wouldn't mind having to pay it again even if it wasn't on sale! My only regret is not buying the DLC for the game. I know it's only a skin, but I'd still do it to support the developer! The Achievement can be a bit boring at times (like for example, click the rotating gear 1,000 times) but still offer a nice goal after you've gotten bored! Can't wait to see more from this franchise! 10/10 :)

This game is awesome! I have a fun game going on just below my browser or discord chats and I can pop down and grow crops or build bots to help with my growing crops and other buildings and it has the loveliest soundtrack to, I had it playing even as I watched a show and I could hear the music gently playing behind the show and the little movement of farming going on. I love this game! I love this game! I love this game
Relaxing game, highly recommended if you have low attention span. You can multitask playing this game while scrolling through social media or doing your homework.
Such a nice game to play while watching Netflix or doing other things
super fun to just let play in the background while you listen to its relaxing soundtrack and do other work

meu cerebro ja esta corroido o suficiente com os tempos modernos quando um jogo conseguiu aumentar minha produtividade em 70% e ajudou no meu comeback academico

ele Ã© que nem aqueles videos de subway surfers com o markiplier no canto, um video de slime no outro e sons de asmr, sÃ³ que melhor e nao te deixa sobrecarregado

Watching lil gold Rusty plopping down on a bench after watering the plants is very satisfying.

The fact that this game continues to improve, add new features/collabs, and update throughout the seasons is delightful.

I've long used small games as a focus tool -- I remember having an ASCII tamagotchi on my desktop at my first office job. The advent of the desktop idler as a dedicated genre has been wonderful, and while it remains niche, it's a thriving genre with some really fun and interesting games (one day I will write my paper about the implications of the differences between desktop and mobile idlers, but I should probably do my actual work first...).Â 

Rusty's Retirement broke subgenre containment and became a mainstream hit, and for good reason -- it's possibly the most complete, deep, and good-looking idler I've played, with excellent desktop features and adjustability.Â 

The developer, Mr Morris Games, previously put out a metroidvania,Â Haiku, the Robot, which was an extremely derivative but still well-made love letter to hollow knight. The best thing Haiku had going for it, in my opinion, was its unique and cohesive visual style, and that continues into Rusty's Retirement, which draws from the character roster of Haiku and uses its fun and unique robot designs to springboard a design for a robo-organic look and feel that's both really original and really appealling. The game is also really huge -- there is just so much to unlock and do, and I appreciate all the automation options which let you make sure exactly what you want to happen is happening while you're doing other things. It strikes a good balance, even in the lategame, of having things be achievably unlockable while still giving you time to be away.

It's just a really lovely little game, and probably the best thing in the genre at the moment, especially for people like me who rely on these games day to day. Check it out if you're curious about the genre!
I live this game, it's easy to navigate around while working or doing other things. There's no pressure for completion and the music is nice an calm.

really fun, but for macos only:
SETTINGS: there is a select button that keeps the game on top. you can hide the taskbar.
it's fun but takes a second to chill and reconfigure. 
fun, and ill definitely play more.

A fun little game that runs at the bottom of your screen while you do other stuff like study or watch something else. 
Would recommend, 8/10.

This game is a must buy to anybody who wants the farming aspect of the Stardew Valley but is overwhelmed by the social aspect of it. This game is purely relaxing easy to leave in the background farming game. Great for having fun while doing your work!!

The amount of times I felt genuine adoration for my tiny little farm while I hacked away at whatever work I needed to do is immeasurable. Easiest purchase ever and a very fun casual completion for other achievement hunters.
one of my favorite idlers! simple to understand and fun to relax and watch everything run on its own on another monitor while doing other things.

I love this little game that runs in the background. I can work on a report or presentation and look over to the side of my computer and see Rusty slowly ambling about working on his garden. Peaceful and fun.
Very relaxing, nice music, robots, vegetables
First game that introduced me to "bottom of your screen" games. Very enjoyable game loop, lovely music.

This game is perfect for anyone who works on their computer, might wait for something (render, compile, load, etc.), and looks for mini moments to enjoy an idler game while still being on their computer without having to pull their phone out. It's so peaceful. 100% recommend.
Good neat idle sim. Recommend it if you do other tasks and want some idle gameplay from time to time
Playing since the demo and still love this game, its nice to have something in the corner from time to time and its really fun to try new layouts with every map.
Fun little passive game. It's nice to get work done and see your robots have farmed you some bio fuel.
Even playing it without the bottom of the screen feature this is still such a lovely game.
Feels like the first proper "bottom-of-your-screen" game, and it nails absolutely everything. If you've tried any of the ones that came afterwards, you will certainly enjoy!
Excellent way to cure the gamers itch while sitting at work.
This game is exactly what it promises to be and even exceeds expectations.
Great so far, don't see any faults in it. Hoping for further updates/DLCs for it to expand on this or a game of similar concept from the dev.
I nice idler farm game. I probably spent far too much time on this one but I wanted to get all of the achievements. It's not difficult but some things do take some planning and consideration.
Awesome little game. It's pretty rare that I hit 100% achievements in a game but this one kept me coming back until I finished them all.

If you work from home, or have other hobbies on the computer where you can't focus on a big game this is a fun little one to run in the background. Super fun and addictive where you can be casual and check in on the crops at your leisure, but has enough meat on the bones to fully optimize and tinker as you wish. Highly recommend :)

Hours and hours and hours of making your desktop funner, for a very low price! Very aesthetically pleasing and therapeutic watching all your decisions play out. Intelligent AI. On an ultrawide monitor, I prefer the vertical orientation myself (none of the store screenshots show this). It does not take up the farthest edge in that setup, but I like it that way anyway since I can see my corner shortcuts. Once you unlock the desert biome, you will definitely start to be challenged on your knowledge and wise placements. The game doesn't explain how everything works, but it's fun to learn this on your own. I still have a lot more biomes to unlock since I spent a lot of time on the first one, and I will definitely continue spending a lot more time playing it. Also, satisfying achievements to pursue. I love this game and would recommend it to pretty much anybody!

Well, I did just about everything there is to do in two nights, but I don't think you're supposed to sit and actively play it for hours a day like that so that may be on me. Honestly, it's such a pleasant unobtrusive little experience, so honest about what it is, that I don't mind and I still think it's worth a few bucks. I wish it did a bit more "offline", but this is probably one I'll come back to.
If my worst complaint is I wish there was more of it, then what's here probably isn't that bad..
terrible for adhd, just enough to distract you while doing other things but great patience training

This game is GOATED!

Pros:
- It runs on the background so you can like do some of your farming stuff while coding or doing other things
- Cozy af
- Not heavy for your PC
- Runs on Mac too 
- Has different seasons, so it will take some time for you to beat it (but let's be honest, u can play in this 24/7 cuz it's a farming sim anw)

Cons:
There's no cons 

Highly recommend this game

Not for me, but I can definitely see the appeal.
Way too slow for me, even to deal with between tasks.

cute game with good vibes and calming music that's stuck in my head. notably rusty works diligently despite being retired. build him lots of benches, he deserves a rest!
i thought i wasn't gonna like the horizontal strip gimmick, but it fit nicely under youtube videos on my second monitor. 
there's a lot of waiting, but i wouldn't say this fits neatly into the idler category. the point at which you can really automate things and progress without paying attention is after you've unlocked most things for your farm. this isn't bad necessarily, just a matter of category.
The original "sit at the bottom of your screen" game. It's cute, it's fun, it's amazing. You should try it. A game does not become genre defining out of nowhere.

I love games like this. Can't get enough games that just chill at the bottom of my screen and have little things happening on them. Not only do I like this games overall vibes I actually like the way unlocking new crops work and the crop chip mods. Not bad as a idle game, but obviously only if you're ok with it being very hands off.
its not that deep. but its cozy and great for running on the side of your workspace

This game is fantastic for those who are multitaskers. If you haven't gathered, the game opens in a small window. That small window can be customized in another of ways. You can choose which side of the screen it takes up, how big the window is, and if it always stays at the front of the other applications you have running, or if it will hide behind others. It's great for when you're working or studying to get things on your farm going, and then taking a 5 minute break later to check on how things are going or start on new tasks. It's very relaxing and fun and offers so much for the price tag. I would recommend it at full price. You definitely will get the most for your money. 

If you're wanting to spend your money on something a little more involved, look elsewhere. But as a busy person who doesn't have time to sit down for long gaming sessions like I used to, this is a fantastic option.

Very chill idle game, I am able to play multiple games or do homework while playing but not having to put all my attention to this game. It has amazing achievements to reach for and different aspects to keep the game interesting.

Great innovative idea. Fun to have running at the bottom of your screen while you watch Impractical Jokers or mind map your plan to take over the world. It makes you feel like you're contributing to the world.
Pretty simple concept - but the best part is how it docks on the side or bottom of the screen. Great for an idle game.
A fun semi-idle (at least to start) game that doesn't fill up your screen or take a lot of resources.

This becomes the first game I have hit 100% achievements for on steam! 

This game perfectly sits at the bottom of your screen and there is something mesmerising about it whilst you watch your crops get harvested and watered by the bots! 

The ultimate cosy game whilst you do other things

I LOVE this game!  I like how it sits on just part of the screen and how I can let it go idle. I have played over 279 hours and got all the achievements. It is just so fun trying to unlock everything. Graphics are nice; updates are cute. I recommend this to anyone who loves to collect, unlock, and virtual farm.

A very chill little game that serves the important function of reminding us that it's okay to slow down a bit, from time to time.

You start off with Rusty, a retired killbot who's laid down his arms for good (or maybe he was an accountant or something - who's to say?), as well as his house, a water source, and a 4x4-tile field - as well as a biofuel converter gizmo.

By planting and harvesting crops, you collect currency, called "spare parts" and represented by a coin icon. Then, by bringing sets of three different crop types to your biofuel converter, you collect some of that as well. Both currencies are used for most construction, and biofuel is used to fuel the basic but potentially numerous helper bots you can plonk down to... well, help out. You can also build houses for various fellow robots to unlock a lot more possibilities, including bees and berry bushes, helper upgrades, decorations and whatnot.

New crop types are unlocked by growing a certain number of the crops available to you. It's for you to decide whether to focus on those crops, or ones with other useful qualities; growth time and water needed tend to go up more and more with more advanced crops, but so does harvest value, biofuel value and number of regrowths before new seeds need to be planted.

Rusty himself is pretty slow-moving. He can rest on a bench (if there is one) which seems to give him a little speed boost, but overall, he - and indeed the helper bots, and his buddy Haiku - could not be described as "fast-moving". [i]And that's okay.[/i] Yes, you can eventually upgrade the helper bots to be faster and carry more with each trip, but the spirit of this game is not so much about constant activity, as it is about planting some seeds, pondering what you'd like to do next, leaning back and watching things unfold slowly but steadily.

It somehow finds a sweet spot of calm, zen-like space-out gameplay, where other games all too often fall into a trap of speed controls and obsessive goal-focused gameplay and always being on the way to something, while never remaining anywhere long enough to enjoy it.

This game may not be a foolproof antidote to the bizarre state of stressed-out impatience we gamers seem to keep falling into, but it might just be a step in the right direction. A reminder, if nothing else, that it's okay - healthy, in fact - to just lean back, stretch out, and watch, sometimes.

Recommended as a chill, relaxing experience.
The music is nice but its kind of odd on my screen not sure how to fix it but Jimbo is farming so that's neat
Its a good deal for its price if you have an extra monitor that you do not use frequently.
my daily dopamine hits before/while i work on my assignment. thx to this game i can finally open my laptop without dreading
First time I played an overlay game, it was great and kind of got me hooked on the genre.
Lovely Idle farming game... too bad I can't play games idley
Its a good idle game but some systems are buggy or just don't work at all. 6-7/10
Cute little coding buddies. Can't wait to see what more is in store for Rusty :)
Very nice game that will sit idal while you complete your work
Solid semi-idler, although I found it more hands-on than I expected.
Fun idler but I took a more hands on approach :D highly recommend
Was recommended this game by a colleague to help with managing ADHD at work - a great game, and would now highly recommend myself.

Like always, leave a review only after 100%ing a game. Dev, you made a fun game that ready got me into idle games. There is a science to the game but after 100hrs you just enjoy the view. Maybe a Rusty 2 one day?
Fun aesthetic little idler that somehow stops my hard drive from crashing while it runs
very cute game its great to play to relax
love this relaxing game play as i doom scroll is the best.
I am obsessed with this game. I can't study without it!
Very cozy, easy to game while working.
Nice game, nice progression
nice and cozy idle game

[b]Overall Verdict: Highly Recommended (A Must-Have Desktop Game!)[/b]

[hr][/hr]

I absolutely [b]love[/b] this game. [i]Rusty's Retirement[/i] is not just an idle farming simulator; it's a [b]uniquely brilliant piece of desktop software[/b] that enhances everything else you do on your PC.

[h3]Why It's a Game-Changer:[/h3]
[list]
[*] [b]Uniquely Designed for Multitasking:[/b] The core featureâ€”having the game sit seamlessly on the bottom of your monitorâ€”is a [b]major selling point[/b]. I mainly played it while [b]studying for classes or watching YouTube/shows[/b], and it provided the perfect, low-effort distraction.
[*] [b]Satisfying Automation:[/b] The progression loop is incredibly rewarding. You start with manual work but quickly unlock and automate your farm with cute robots, allowing you to gradually shift to a true idle experience where you only make occasional, meaningful changes.
[*] [b]Fun and Achievable Goals:[/b] Hunting for the achievements was a blast and gave me a reason to keep expanding and optimizing my little farm. Itâ€™s an overall unique and interesting game that's easy to lose hours in.
[/list]

I was so impressed by this title and its unique approach that I happily purchased the [b]Support Pack[/b] to back the developers. It also led me to check out their other game, [i]Haiku the Robot[/i], which shows the versatility of the studio.

If you are looking for a cozy, automated experience that won't take up your full screen and will keep you company while you work or browse, look no further. I will definitely be looking for games similar to this in the future!

negative.review:
Less of a game and more of interactive wall paper.  If you go into this looking for an idle game this really isn't much of a game.  IF you go into this trying to optimize production structures there really isn't that type of game.  And to my knowledge there isn't an endgame or goal.  

Basically treat it like background music and something to occasionally look at and its kind of interesting.  If you're looking for an actual game I'd look else where.
I like the concept and quality, But there is too little content. No depth at all.

Basically treat it like background music and something to occasionally look at and its kind of interesting.  If you're looking for an actual game I'd look else where.

Looks like a nice enough game but it does not work properly on Linux (runs on a black window, no overlay possible, kinda defeats the concept...). Would have preferred to know that before buying.
I like the concept and quality, But there is too little content. No depth at all.

Less of a game and more of interactive wall paper.  If you go into this looking for an idle game this really isn't much of a game.  IF you go into this trying to optimize production structures there really isn't that type of game.  And to my knowledge there isn't an endgame or goal.  

Basically treat it like background music and something to occasionally look at and its kind of interesting.  If you're looking for an actual game I'd look else where.
